name: Hotel Indigo Raleigh Durham Airport at RTP

reviews.text: Wow, I hardly ever write a negative review here on Trip Advisor, but this Hotel Indigo in Raleigh makes the exception. From check in to check out, I did not even feel like I was in Raleigh. The staff we encountered (except one fellow at the desk Thursday night and the maintanence man) were short on pleasantries and never seemed interested in the guests. Check in was a mere handing of the key cards, nothing more. We were not greeting as Priority Club members, were never offered a room upgrade, I swear this hotel is embarressed to be a part of the Holiday Inn family.
reviews.title: Just not what I expected....

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here, and since I had pre paid for the advance purchase rate, we knew we wouldn't be switching hotels, and decided to just be sure to spend as little time as possible in this sad hotel.
reviews.title: Very good room, disappointing fitness center

reviews.text: The pool was literally the smallest pool I have ever seen in a hotel. There was a coffee center but it was reserved for "airline staff only". Really? A hotel that can't have free coffee in the lobby for all? Come on now.
reviews.title: Great stay for the price

reviews.text: The bed was just weird. The mattress was sloped upward at the foot end.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me tell you about the restaurant. We didn't eat there but decided to have a drink at the bar. There was a copy of the menu in the room that said Blue Moon beer was $4.00 and that's what we ordered. We were charged $5.00 for each beer. We asked why, she said they were $5.00. We looked at the menu on the bar, and that listed Blue Moon as $4.50. We pointed out the prices in the room and at the abr menu, her line was "Oh, we have new menus, it's supposed to be $45 but I'll charge you $4.50. Well, duh, damn right you will charge us what the MENU says.
reviews.title: Wasn't impressed

reviews.text: I'll start by saying that I'm a loyal Intercontinental Hotel group patron so my experience with Holiday Inn hotels is pretty extensive. I can honestly say that I've never had such a negative experience with this hotel group as I had the night I stayed here. From the painfully slow check in to the inflexible and sometimes rude staff, service was atrocious.
reviews.title: Beautiful building, terrible service

reviews.text: I've heard the motto "the customer is always right;" that is something that you cannot expect at this hotel, even if the information the customer has is from the hotel. The brochures given to me at check in listed the wrong times for breakfast. When I came during the printed time,
reviews.title: Too expensive

reviews.text: I was offered a cold, curt apology and told to find another option.
reviews.title: Jet Engine Aircon

reviews.text: Now the good: the building is gorgeous, with a great design and very comfortable accommodations. The hotel design and layout are the best I've seen in the local area.
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

reviews.text: So in summary, I think I'd have a hard time going back to the hotel just because of how poor the service was.
reviews.title: Another great Hotel Indigo experience - and convenient to airport!

reviews.text: I love the ambiance of Hotel Indigo. Bright, contemporary design. The vibrant suites colors give the feel as if you are staying a in a friend’s guest room. Hard wood floors. Small carpeted area with love seat and ottoman. ….The front desk representative greeted us with a bottles of water and a choice of chocolate goodies <ooh la la, I’ll take it!>...Glass enclosed showers. Complimentary Aveda products <always make my heart sing>. The bath also included cleansing and beauty make-up towelettes <nice touch!>
reviews.title: Hidden Gem!

reviews.text: Large comfy beds. I thought the head pillows could have been a tad bit larger but they provide you a few extras. Plenty of workspace area with desk. Swivel flatscreen television. No mini-fridge in room if you were looking for that.
reviews.title: Bright change from boring old hotels

reviews.text: Hotel Indigo is a very eco-friendly hotel, similar to the Aloft brand. I found the A/C a little noisier than my liking when turned on. But that could also be by design. The stay was still comfortable without the added coolness.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed

reviews.text: I didn’t have an opportunity to visit the fitness center. We had an event which I think was in Downtown Durham, and it was about a 15 minute drive away. Doesn’t seem to have a lot of late night food options nearby – fyi for the night owls.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel. Recommended.

reviews.text: Good stay. Quiet area. Great place for those near the area that may want a quiet getaway or staycation. Looking forward to coming back.
reviews.title: Alternative to the traditional hotel

reviews.text: My wife, dog and I stayed for six (6) nights at the Hotel Indigo recently, and we had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff were all incredible and willing to help us in any way possible. The hotel room was large and very clean, and the cocktails at the bar were excellent and reasonable priced.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!!

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for business and leisure travelers as well as families. My wife and I will be back to stay again in the very near future. This Hotel Indigo is one of the best in the country!!!
reviews.title: Solid Choice for RTP

reviews.text: I was very happy with the hotel itself. It seemed brand new and spotlessly clean. The rooms were very spacious and super comfortable. Service was helpful. It's great if you're in the area for business, as there are countless corporate type offices nearby, but don't stay here if you're looking for something to do after hours. There's nothing around. I got tired of eating in the hotel restaurant, so I walked next door to the Hilton I could see from my window to try their restaurant and bar...not exactly happening either...but for RTP business, this is a solid choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: Our family of 5 really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Indigo! The decor is beautiful, bright, and fun! The room was very roomy and extremely comfortable. The bathroom is very spacious... Plenty of room for our 3 teenage daughters! We had great customer service as well; the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. One of my daughters forgot her Ipod, we thought we were just out of luck on that; housekeeping found it and they mailed it to us! We will definitely stay here again! Beautiful hotel!
reviews.title: Very Sorely Disappointed

reviews.text: The quick points:
reviews.title: Fresh Design & Comfortable Room

description: Hotel Indigo Durham Research Triangle Park (RTP), North Carolina, is a place where you will enjoy every moment of your stay. Imagine a new branded boutique hotel designed to deliver guests a distinctive and engaging experience. Let us inspire you with our refreshing design and intimate service. 'Curl Up' and escape from the ordinary. Our 100% smoke-free hotel offers cozy, airy, and inviting guest rooms with oversized beds, plush bedding, hardwood-style flooring with area rugs, 42 HDTVs and spa-inspired shower. In public spaces, the scent, music, artwork, murals are changed to reflect the season. Our hotel is conveniently located near Raleigh Durham airport (RDU) for business travelers at RTP which is the heart of the Raleigh, Cary, and Durham metropolitan area with more than 170 companies. Our hotel offers free high speed Internet access, a business center, conference room, and boardroom. We provide a complimentary shuttle to/from RDU airport as well as local businesses. We are a short drive to many attractions including museums, RBC Center, Univ of North Carolina (UNC), Duke Univ, and NC State Univ (NCSU).At our boutique hotel, you can enjoy the heated indoor pool, whirlpool and Phitness Room. Satisfy your discriminating palate at Phi, an on-site casual restaurant and lounge serving fine cuisine. Starbucks coffee is also available at the restaurant. You will find Hotel Indigo Durham RTP simply unforgettable.
